short_summary: Lease of space for approximately 10 years in Ile du Cap aux Meules, Iles-de-la-Madeleine, Quebec, with contiguous interior and exterior storage spaces, meeting certain criteria.
description: The proposed spaces must be located in the same building and be contiguous. They must satisfy or be capable of satisfying the following criteria:" Some details left out for brevity.

full_summary:
# Expression of Interest (EOI) for Leasing of Space in Ile du Cap-aux-Meules, Quebec
## File Number: 81002829
### Publication Date: August 10, 2023
### Closing Date: August 25, 2023

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites interested parties to provide information regarding the availability of space for lease that meets the requirements outlined below:

### Leasing Requirements

* Lease term of approximately 10 years, commencing on or about June 1, 2024, with options to extend the lease for one (1) additional period of three (3) years and one additional period of two (2) years
* Approximate usable square meters (um2) of space:
	+ Interior storage space: 214.1 um2, contiguous and located on the ground floor
	+ Exterior storage space: 450 um2, contiguous and located in the same building
* Space must be available approximately 12 weeks prior to the lease commencement date
* The space must fulfill the following criteria:
	+ Located in the same building and contiguous
	+ Interior storage space must be contiguous, unobstructed, and on the same floor
	+ Minimum clear finished ceiling height of 5486.4mm
	+ Loading facility at grade level with convenient access and a minimum overhead door size of 4572m x 4876m
	+ Exterior storage space layout must allow for the access and storage of a 15.24m long boat trailer
	+ Building must be fully accessible to people with reduced mobility
	+ Located in the geographical limits of Ile du Cap-aux-Meules
* Space must comply with PSPC's Standards for Leased Accommodation

Please note that PSPC may wish to visit or inspect the proposed space upon reasonable notice and may conduct a threat and risk assessment to evaluate potential threats to the security of the proposed space and the public.

### Response Submission

Interested parties are requested to submit their response to this EOI in writing to the following address:

Public Services and Procurement Canada
Place Bonaventure, South-West Portal
800, de la Gauchetière Street West, Suite 7300
Montréal (Québec) H5A 1L6

or by email to:

Audrey Paquette
Senior Leasing Officer
[audrey.paquette@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:audrey.pa
